H0.text: Diameter of the planet causes a solar day, which on Jupiter lasts only 9 hours and 50 minutes.

H1.text: The rotational speed of the planet causes a solar day on Jupiter, which lasts only 9 hours and 50 minutes.

H2.text: The speed of a planet in orbit around the sun causes a solar day, which on Jupiter lasts only 9 hours and 50 minutes.

H3.text: The diameter of the orbit of a planet around the sun causes a solar day, as illustrated by Jupiter’s solar day lasting only 9 hours and 50 minutes.

A4.text: System I applies to latitudes from 7° N to 7° S; its period is the planet's shortest, at 9h 50 m 30.0s.
